name: Gluten Free Vegan Apple Crumble Pie
description: This Apple Crumble Pie is vegan, gluten free and very low in oil. It is decadent served with a scoop of non-dairy vanilla ice cream.
recipeIngredient: 1  Gluten Free Pie Crust (see link in instructions below)
6  large apples, peeled, cored and sliced 1/4 inch thick (I used a combination of granny smith and pink lady apples) (8-10 cups total)
3/4 cup rolled oats (make sure they are gluten free certified)

recipeInstructions.text: The Crust: Prepare the gluten free pie crust, including baking for 10-12 minutes. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: The Crust: Prepare the gluten free pie crust, including baking for 10-12 minutes. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: The Apple Filling: In a large bowl, toss together the apples, brown sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, ground cinnamon, nutmeg and pure vanilla extract. Set aside while the oven preheats.
recipeInstructions.name: The Apple Filling: In a large bowl, toss together the apples, brown sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, ground cinnamon, nutmeg and pure vanilla extract. Set aside while the oven preheats.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: The Crumble Topping: In a medium sized bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond flour, brown sugar and cinnamon. Now using a small spoon or rubber spatula, mix in the melted coconut oil (or applesauce). The mixture will be thick and crumbly.
recipeInstructions.name: The Crumble Topping: In a medium sized bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond flour, brown sugar and cinnamon. Now using a small spoon or rubber spatula, mix in the melted coconut oil (or applesauce). The mixture will be thick and crumbly.

recipeInstructions.text: Spoon all of the apple filling into the pie crust, but leave some of the juice in the bowl. This will help the pie not be too watery.
recipeInstructions.name: Spoon all of the apple filling into the pie crust, but leave some of the juice in the bowl. This will help the pie not be too watery.

recipeInstructions.text: Now sprinkle the crumble topping onto the apples.
recipeInstructions.name: Now sprinkle the crumble topping onto the apples.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 45-55 minutes, until the top is golden brown and the apples have softened and thickened. Use a pie crust shield to prevent burning, or make one out of foil (link above to see how).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 45-55 minutes, until the top is golden brown and the apples have softened and thickened. Use a pie crust shield to prevent burning, or make one out of foil (link above to see how).

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool for 2-3 hours preferably before slicing and serving, as the time will allow the filling to thicken up quite a bit. Serve with non-dairy vanilla ice cream or coconut whip if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool for 2-3 hours preferably before slicing and serving, as the time will allow the filling to thicken up quite a bit. Serve with non-dairy vanilla ice cream or coconut whip if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover pie leftovers and store in the refrigerator for up to 4 or 5 days, if it lasts that long!
